DOC.criteria: Diagnosis NYHA class III heart failure At least 1 heart failure hospitalization within previous 12 month Patients reduce LVEF heart failure receive beta blocker 3 month ACEI ARB one month unless investigator 's opinion , patient intolerant beta blocker , ACEI ARB BMI ≤ 35 . Patients BMI > 35 require chest circumference measure axillary level . If > 65 inch patient eligible study . Pulmonary artery branch diameter ≥ 7mm ( implant target artery assess right heart catheterization ) Active infection History recurrent ( > 1 ) pulmonary embolism deep vein thrombosis Inability tolerate right heart catheterization A major cardiovascular event ( e.g. , myocardial infarction , open heart surgery , stroke , etc . ) within previous 2 month Cardiac resynchronization device ( CRT ) implant within previous 3 month Glomerular Filtration Rate ( GFR ) < 25 ml/min ( obtain within 2 week implant ) nonresponsive diuretic therapy chronic renal dialysis Congenital heart disease mechanical right heart valve Likely undergo heart transplantation VAD within next 6 month Known coagulation disorder Hypersensitivity allergy aspirin , and/or clopidogrel
